text: Ah, thanks. I thought it was somehow locked already because the theme folder name is in gray :slightly_smiling_face:
We visually denote theme folders differently since they have meaning but we dont lock by default because you can create them in the design manager too

Hey <@UDHT6N5SM> would you be able to submit a support ticket or add this issue in the dev community forum* (<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CLJJXGTC0/p1593807240132200?thread_ts=1593797694.132100&cid=CLJJXGTC0>)? Sounds like something might be off and would want to get someone to take a look at it. If you submit a support ticket, please feel free to send me a direct message with the ticket ID.

Running into that issue again where `hs watch` isn't uploading when files are changed. Has anyone else run into this and/or found a fix? Running the latest version, VSCode, Windows/WSL Ubuntu

EDIT: My bad, doing some research and it's a WSL bug, not HubSpot's

For anyone else that might run into this, the issue was I was using WSL2, but my project files were on the Windows C drive instead of the WSL VM filesystem. Changing the folder location fixed the watcher
